query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Dal centro al cerchio, e sì dal cerchio al centro 2 movesi l’acqua in un ritondo vaso, 3 secondo ch’è percosso fuori o dentro:
4 ne la mia mente fé sùbito caso 5 questo ch’io dico, sì come si tacque 6 la glorïosa vita di Tommaso,
7 per la similitudine che nacque 8 del suo parlare e di quel di Beatrice, 9 a cui sì cominciar, dopo lui, piacque:
10 «A costui fa mestieri, e nol vi dice 11 né con la voce né pensando ancora, 12 d’un altro vero andare a la radice.
query.result:
**English:**
1 From the center to the circumference, and likewise from the circumference to the center, 2 the water moves in a round vessel, 3 according to whether it is struck from outside or from within:
4 in my mind this that I say suddenly occurred, 5 as soon as the glorious life of Thomas fell silent,
6 because of the similarity that arose 7 between his speech and that of Beatrice, 8 to whom it pleased to begin, after him, thus:
9 "This man needs, and he does not tell you 10 either with his voice or yet by thinking, 11 to go to the root of another truth.
**Malay:**
1 Dari pusat ke keliling, dan begitu juga dari keliling ke pusat, 2 air bergerak dalam bejana bundar, 3 sesuai dengan apakah ia dipukul dari luar atau dari dalam:
4 dalam pikiranku hal yang kukatakan ini tiba-tiba terjadi, 5 segera setelah kehidupan Thomas yang mulia terdiam,
6 karena kesamaan yang muncul 7 antara ucapannya dan ucapan Beatrice, 8 yang kepadanya berkenan untuk memulai, setelah dia, demikian:
9 "Orang ini membutuhkan, dan dia tidak memberitahumu 10 baik dengan suaranya maupun dengan berpikir, 11 untuk pergi ke akar kebenaran yang lain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Come, da più letizia pinti e tratti, 20 a la fïata quei che vanno a rota 21 levan la voce e rallegrano li atti,
22 così, a l’orazion pronta e divota, 23 li santi cerchi mostrar nova gioia 24 nel torneare e ne la mira nota.
query.result:
**English:**
19 As those who are drawn and painted with greater joy, 20 at the feast, those who go in procession 21 raise their voices and gladden their actions,
22 so, at the ready and devout prayer, 23 the holy circles showed new joy 24 in the circling and in the wonderful melody.
**Malay:**
19 Seperti mereka yang ditarik dan dilukis dengan lebih banyak kegembiraan, 20 pada pesta, mereka yang berarak 21 meninggikan suara mereka dan menggembirakan tindakan mereka,
22 begitu juga, pada doa yang siap dan khusyuk, 23 lingkaran-lingkaran suci menunjukkan kegembiraan baru 24 dalam perputaran dan dalam melodi yang indah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Qual si lamenta perché qui si moia 26 per viver colà sù, non vide quive 27 lo refrigerio de l’etterna ploia.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Who laments because he is here 26 to live up there, did not see here 27 the refreshment of the eternal rain.
**Malay:**
25 Yang meratap karena dia ada di sini 26 untuk hidup di sana, tidak melihat di sini 27 kesejukan hujan abadi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Quell’ uno e due e tre che sempre vive 29 e regna sempre in tre e ’n due e ’n uno, 30 non circunscritto, e tutto circunscrive,
31 tre volte era cantato da ciascuno 32 di quelli spirti con tal melodia, 33 ch’ad ogne merto saria giusto muno.
query.result:
**English:**
28 That one and two and three who always lives 29 and always reigns in three and two and one, 30 not circumscribed, and circumscribes all,
31 was sung three times by each 32 of those spirits with such melody, 33 that to each merit it gave just reward.
**Malay:**
28 Yang satu dan dua dan tiga yang selalu hidup 29 dan selalu memerintah dalam tiga dan dua dan satu, 30 tidak terbatas, dan membatasi semua,
31 dinyanyikan tiga kali oleh masing-masing 32 roh-roh itu dengan melodi sedemikian rupa, 33 sehingga untuk setiap kebaikan diberikan upah yang adil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 E io udi’ ne la luce più dia 35 del minor cerchio una voce modesta, 36 forse qual fu da l’angelo a Maria,
37 risponder: «Quanto fia lunga la festa 38 di paradiso, tanto il nostro amore 39 si raggerà dintorno cotal vesta.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And I heard in the light more diaphanous 35 of the smaller circle a modest voice, 36 perhaps like that of the angel to Mary,
37 answering: "As long as the feast 38 of paradise will last, so long will our love 39 radiate around this garment.
**Malay:**
34 Dan aku mendengar dalam cahaya yang lebih terang 35 dari bulatan yang lebih kecil suara yang sederhana, 36 mungkin seperti suara malaikat kepada Maria,
37 menjawab: "Sepanjang pesta 38 surga akan berlangsung, begitu lama cinta kita 39 akan bersinar di sekeliling pakaian ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 La sua chiarezza séguita l’ardore; 41 l’ardor la visïone, e quella è tanta, 42 quant’ ha di grazia sovra suo valore.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Its brightness follows its ardor; 41 the ardor, the vision; and that is as great 42 as the grace that exceeds its worth.
**Malay:**
40 Kecerahannya mengikuti semangatnya; 41 semangatnya, penglihatannya; dan itu sebesar, 42 rahmat yang melampaui nilainya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Tanto mi parver sùbiti e accorti 62 e l’uno e l’altro coro a dicer «Amme!», 63 che ben mostrar disio d’i corpi morti:
64 forse non pur per lor, ma per le mamme, 65 per li padri e per li altri che fuor cari 66 anzi che fosser sempiterne fiamme.
query.result:
**English:**
61 So sudden and alert they seemed to me, 62 both choirs, to say, "To us!" 63 that they clearly showed their desire for the dead bodies:
64 perhaps not only for themselves, but for their mothers, 65 for their fathers, and for the others who were dear to them 66 before they became eternal flames.
**Malay:**
61 Begitu tiba-tiba dan sigap mereka tampak bagiku, 62 kedua paduan suara itu, untuk berkata, "Kepada kami!" 63 sehingga mereka jelas menunjukkan keinginan mereka terhadap mayat-mayat itu:
64 mungkin bukan hanya untuk diri mereka sendiri, tetapi untuk ibu mereka, 65 untuk ayah mereka, dan untuk orang-orang lain yang mereka sayangi 66 sebelum mereka menjadi api abadi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Ed ecco intorno, di chiarezza pari, 68 nascere un lustro sopra quel che v’era, 69 per guisa d’orizzonte che rischiari.
query.result:
**English:**
67 And behold, all around, with equal brightness, 68 a light was born over what was there, 69 in the manner of a dawning horizon.
**Malay:**
67 Dan lihatlah, di sekeliling, dengan cahaya yang sama, 68 lahirlah cahaya di atas apa yang ada di sana, 69 seperti ufuk yang bersinar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 E sì come al salir di prima sera 71 comincian per lo ciel nove parvenze, 72 sì che la vista pare e non par vera,
73 parvemi lì novelle sussistenze 74 cominciare a vedere, e fare un giro 75 di fuor da l’altre due circunferenze.
query.result:
**English:**
70 And just as at the coming of early evening 71 new appearances begin in the sky, 72 so that the sight seems and does not seem real,
73 it seemed to me that new substances 74 began to appear there, and to make a circle 75 outside the other two circumferences.
**Malay:**
70 Dan seperti pada saat datangnya senja 71 penampakan-penampakan baru mulai terlihat di langit, 72 sehingga pemandangan itu tampak dan tidak tampak nyata,
73 tampak bagiku di sana hakikat-hakikat baru 74 mulai terlihat, dan membuat sebuah lingkaran 75 di luar dua keliling lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Oh vero sfavillar del Santo Spiro! 77 come si fece sùbito e candente 78 a li occhi miei che, vinti, nol soffriro!
79 Ma Bëatrice sì bella e ridente 80 mi si mostrò, che tra quelle vedute 81 si vuol lasciar che non seguir la mente.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Oh true sparkling of the Holy Spirit! 77 How suddenly and brightly it became 78 to my eyes, which, vanquished, could not bear it!
79 But Beatrice, so beautiful and smiling, 80 showed herself to me, that among those visions 81 one must allow the mind not to follow.
**Malay:**
76 Wahai percikan cahaya Roh Kudus yang sejati! 77 Betapa tiba-tiba dan terangnya cahaya itu 78 bagi mataku, yang kalah, tidak dapat menahannya!
79 Tetapi Beatrice yang begitu cantik dan tersenyum, 80 menunjukkan dirinya kepadaku, bahwa di antara penglihatan-penglihatan itu 81 seseorang harus membiarkan pikiran untuk tidak mengikutinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Quindi ripreser li occhi miei virtute 83 a rilevarsi; e vidimi translato 84 sol con mia donna in più alta salute.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Then my virtuous eyes regained their strength 83 to rise up; and I saw myself translated, 84 alone with my lady, to a greater salvation.
**Malay:**
82 Kemudian mataku yang berbudi memperoleh kembali kekuatannya 83 untuk bangkit; dan kulihat diriku dipindahkan, 84 sendirian dengan kekasihku, kepada keselamatan yang lebih besar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Ben m’accors’ io ch’io era più levato, 86 per l’affocato riso de la stella, 87 che mi parea più roggio che l’usato.
query.result:
**English:**
85 I realized that I had climbed higher, 86 because of the fiery glow of the star, 87 which seemed redder to me than usual.
**Malay:**
85 Aku benar-benar menyadari bahwa aku telah mendaki lebih tinggi, 86 karena cahaya bintang yang menyala-nyala, 87 yang tampak lebih merah dari biasanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Con tutto ’l core e con quella favella 89 ch’è una in tutti, a Dio feci olocausto, 90 qual conveniesi a la grazia novella.
query.result:
**English:**
88 With all my heart and with that speech 89 which is one in all, I made a burnt offering to God, 90 as is fitting for the new grace.
**Malay:**
88 Dengan sepenuh hati dan dengan ucapan 89 yang sama bagi semua, aku membuat persembahan bakaran kepada Tuhan, 90 sebagaimana layaknya bagi kasih karunia yang baru.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Di corno in corno e tra la cima e ’l basso 110 si movien lumi, scintillando forte 111 nel congiugnersi insieme e nel trapasso:
112 così si veggion qui diritte e torte, 113 veloci e tarde, rinovando vista, 114 le minuzie d’i corpi, lunghe e corte,
115 moversi per lo raggio onde si lista 116 talvolta l’ombra che, per sua difesa, 117 la gente con ingegno e arte acquista.
query.result:
**English:**
109 From horn to horn and between the top and the base 110 the lights move, shining brightly 111 in their conjunction and in their passing:
112 thus here are seen, straight and crooked, 113 fast and slow, renewing the sight, 114 the minute particles of bodies, long and short,
115 moving through the beam of light that sometimes outlines 116 the shadow that people, with their ingenuity and art, 117 acquire for their protection.
**Malay:**
109 Dari tanduk ke tanduk dan antara puncak dan dasar 110 cahaya-cahaya bergerak, bersinar terang 111 dalam pertemuan mereka dan dalam perjalanan mereka:
112 begitulah terlihat di sini lurus dan bengkok, 113 cepat dan lambat, memperbarui pandangan, 114 partikel-partikel kecil dari tubuh, panjang dan pendek,
115 bergerak melalui berkas cahaya yang terkadang membentuk garis 116 bayangan yang, untuk pertahanannya, 117 orang-orang dengan kecerdikan dan seni memperolehnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 E come giga e arpa, in tempra tesa 119 di molte corde, fa dolce tintinno 120 a tal da cui la nota non è intesa,
121 così da’ lumi che lì m’apparinno 122 s’accogliea per la croce una melode 123 che mi rapiva, sanza intender l’inno.
query.result:
**English:**
118 And like a zither and a harp, in tight tension 119 of many strings, makes a sweet tinkling 120 to one for whom the note is not understood,
121 so from the lights that appeared to me there 122 a melody gathered around the cross 123 that enraptured me, without understanding the hymn.
**Malay:**
118 Dan seperti kecapi dan harpa, dalam tegangan yang ketat 119 dari banyak tali, membuat dentingan yang manis 120 kepada seseorang yang tidak mengerti notnya,
121 begitu juga dari cahaya-cahaya yang muncul di hadapanku di sana 122 sebuah melodi berkumpul di sekitar salib 123 yang membuatku terpesona, tanpa mengerti himnenya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Ben m’accors’ io ch’elli era d’alte lode, 125 però ch’a me venìa «Resurgi» e «Vinci» 126 come a colui che non intende e ode.
query.result:
**English:**
124 I realized well that he was worthy of high praise, 125 but to me came only "Resurgi" and "Vinci," 126 like to one who hears but does not understand.
**Malay:**
124 Aku benar-benar menyadari bahwa dia layak dipuji, 125 tetapi yang kudengar hanyalah "Resurgi" dan "Vinci," 126 seperti orang yang mendengar tetapi tidak mengerti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Ïo m’innamorava tanto quinci, 128 che ’nfino a lì non fu alcuna cosa 129 che mi legasse con sì dolci vinci.
query.result:
**English:**
127 I fell in love so much with it there, 128 that up to that point there was nothing 129 that bound me with such sweet bonds.
**Malay:**
127 Aku jatuh cinta begitu dalam di sana, 128 sehingga sampai saat itu tidak ada apa pun 129 yang mengikatku dengan ikatan yang begitu manis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Forse la mia parola par troppo osa, 131 posponendo il piacer de li occhi belli, 132 ne’ quai mirando mio disio ha posa;
133 ma chi s’avvede che i vivi suggelli 134 d’ogne bellezza più fanno più suso, 135 e ch’io non m’era lì rivolto a quelli,
136 escusar puommi di quel ch’io m’accuso 137 per escusarmi, e vedermi dir vero: 138 ché ’l piacer santo non è qui dischiuso,
139 perché si fa, montando, più sincero.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Perhaps my words seem too bold, 131 postponing the pleasure of the beautiful eyes, 132 in which, gazing, my desire finds repose;
133 but whoever realizes that the living seals 134 of every beauty make more beauty above, 135 and that I had not turned to them there,
136 can excuse me for what I accuse myself of 137 in order to excuse myself and see me tell the truth: 138 for the holy pleasure is not revealed here,
139 because it becomes more sincere as one ascends.
**Malay:**
130 Mungkin kata-kataku tampak terlalu berani, 131 menunda kesenangan dari mata yang indah, 132 yang dengan memandangnya, hasratku menemukan ketenangan;
133 tetapi siapa pun yang menyadari bahwa meterai hidup 134 dari setiap keindahan membuat lebih banyak keindahan di atas, 135 dan bahwa aku tidak berpaling kepada mereka di sana,
136 dapat memaafkanku atas apa yang ku tuduhkan pada diriku sendiri 137 untuk memaafkanku dan melihatku mengatakan yang sebenarnya: 138 karena kesenangan suci tidak terungkap di sini,
139 karena itu menjadi lebih tulus saat seseorang naik.
